reason: The relation >= appears in two places: 'phi(m) >= 0' for M-positive states, and 'pi(g_j) >= 0' for constrained representations. In the first case, >= is standard ordering on R (assuming phi(m) is real). But in the second case, what does pi(g_j) >= 0 mean for an operator? Is this the positive operator ordering? This requires pi(g_j) to be self-adjoint first. None of this is defined.
